website_summaries.verdict: While Newport sandals are practical for numerous outdoor activities and light trail hiking during warm months, they aren't practical or comfortable for all men or conditions.
pros: A good choice for men who like a flexible, breathable fit for a variety of warm-weather outdoor activities
Sandal style is less constrictive than other KEENs on our list
cons: Fit some men tightly at first, but may stretch out with wear

customer_reviews.title: As nice as the H2's, but feel a little smaller
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as replacements for a pair of Keen Newport H2 sandals. They feel similar and I prefer the look of leather instead of polyester. I'm not sure if it's because they're new, but they do feel a bit smaller in the toe box than the H2's. I purchased a size 10 like my H2's and wish I had gone with a 10.5. Hopefully they will loosen up a bit as they age.
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other Keen sandals but I've gone back to the tried and true original Newports in leather. Pure comfort from the moment you put them on your feet. Great for walking and hiking....in or out of water. I can wear them all day and my feet stay happy. I prefer the men's size 8 to the women's 9.5 for the wider and deeper toe box. A great sandal that lasts, making it worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: CLB in Syracuse

customer_reviews.title: They fit fine! I'll buy them again when I wear these ...
customer_reviews.text: First durable pair of sandals I've ever owned. I ordered them one half size larger than usual. They fit fine! I'll buy them again when I wear these out. Buy the way; I'm wearing socks with these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I tried to like it.
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'10" 176 pound and wear 10.5 size shoes. So I ordered a size 10.5 and found it a bit small. I returned it and ordered a size 11. Now the size fits me fine but a different issue came up: the side strap of the shoe is a bit high which cuts right into the tip of my calf bone making it very uncomfortable standing ot walking. Well, they need to go back again.
customer_reviews.author: Juno

customer_reviews.title: and it is getting worse. Not what I expected from these sandals
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 pair of these in different colors. This pair of Keen Newports I bought back in Oct of 2013. I wear them in infrequently, and only for everyday walking. Nothing rugged. They still look new, but the heel has started coming apart on the right side one. The top pad and the main sole have pulled apart at the back seam, and it is getting worse. Not what I expected from these sandals. For the price, a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: William T Oliver

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: KEEN SUCKS!! Shoes fall apart and they don't stand by their product. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: made in china beware ,
customer_reviews.text: made in china beware , not a true to size this is my second pair , first pair made in Mexico very disappointed waited to long to return
customer_reviews.author: bluenote

customer_reviews.title: do not buy-glue comes off and they become garbage
customer_reviews.text: i got them end of last year, used them only lightly for a few months and the glue came off on the flap holding the shoe together. warranty case was denied. they said that the model was made in 2012 and they do not warrant that. i called them and was treated without respect in a condescending way. keen does not stand behind their products. as you can see from the pictures the shoes are almost new. i recommend to buy chacos instead. i own two pair of chacos for almost ten years and they are still holding up and they even look like new. chaco stands behind their products offering lifelong warranty.
customer_reviews.author: fred911

customer_reviews.title: Bought sandals less than a year ago, threads came loose and sandal started to fall apart...
customer_reviews.text: I contacted the Keen representative and he declined my request to repair or replace the shoes. It was declined because of the manufacturing date of the shoe which was in 2017, I bought the shoes in 2018 late June. The store where I bought evidently did not move the stock fast enough! Keen no! Tevas yes!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S. Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Not Built Well Anymore
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these back when they were first introduced. That first pair I bought lasted 10 years and I loved them. When the back strap separated from the sole I was devastated and immediately ordered another pair. I'm not sure what changed but the back strap blew out again within a year or so. Still, I loved the shoe an ordered a third pair and again about a year and half in the strap again separated from the sole. It is currently being held together with Shoe Goo. Quality had definitely diminished over the years...
customer_reviews.author: Rob Ostermaier

customer_reviews.title: I find them reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've been a sandle hiker for 20 years. Mountains, streams, desert and marsh. I'll wear nothing else if the temp allows. I wear them almost all year for work and play. I get a year to a year and a half per pair. Socks in damp and/or cool weather and also after creek crossings, to swiften the drying process, make order a non issue. So far, 8 years, I swear by them. Adam
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Good, but don't last as long as they used to.
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Keen Newports every day for quite a few years. They used to last a couple years of hard use, but the last pair I bought last winter hasn't. The straps always pull out from the soles, but I've now got 4 straps detached and the fabric is ripping at the top of the straps. I'm buying one more pair to see if I just had a bad set, but the pair before didn't last as long as they used to either. It would help if the strap wrapped all the way around through the sole. They are comfortable and I appreciate the toe protection.
customer_reviews.author: Tok-Hui M.

customer_reviews.title: Stuff gets caught in the sandal & won't come out
customer_reviews.text: I have had these about 6 months. A very comfortable, easy to wear, popular sandal. The problem is they are only good for wearing around town. With the open heel rocks, sticks, thorns, & everything else gets caught in the sandal and with the closed toe there is no way to get it out without sitting down and shaking your foot up near you face or taking the shoe off. As much as I like the fit and the way they hold up even while wet I did purchase them to hike off the pavement. I would not purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Z

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a durable sandal? This is it.
customer_reviews.text: Let me preface this by saying that I've had my pair of these Keens for ten years. Ten. I bought them in the Navy in 2004 and I've been everywhere with them. Islands in Italy. Germany. Boating. Hiking. Biking. Painting. Kicking. You get the drift. They are still in my closet ready for another summer of abuse. I absolutely LOVE them. If you buy any pair of sandals, you're wasting your money. These are the real deal. I wish I could show you them, but they're shy. :-) Still comfortable. Still durable. Still awesome. Buy and you'll rack up the experiences. Peace and good journeys.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: If there are more comfortable sandals out there, let me know
customer_reviews.text: I have worn the Keen Newport Sandals in Bison until they are slap worn out. The only thing that others have said they don't like about the Newport is that they stink when worn barefoot. I always wear socks with mine; people laugh at me (including my wife) and I don't care. I usually wear bike socks or the new, wool socks and never have a problem with odor. Works for me and I can't believe there's a more comfortable shoe available (at 63 I've worn a lot of shoes) Do yourself a favor, gents, buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get them Now -Next Years Version is Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: These are the original high quality Keen Sandals. Heavy gauge sole, strong construction, compressible foot bed for comfort. After being to the store yesterday where they have a display of new Keen sandals I was appalled at how poorly constructed the new version is...the plastic is akin to the stuff they use on flip flops, the upper construction enters the shoe a full 1/4 from the edge, overall a cheap shadow of these shoes. Hopefully Keen will not go the way of so many other shoe companies and cheapen their shoes to the point of undesirability. You may want to consider an extra pair if you hope to find them again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: ZenReader

customer_reviews.title: On sandle my husband will wear!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only sandle that my husbsnd will wear. He is extremely pickie when it comes to shoes. These as really comfortable and are the only thing he wears all summer. He sometimes wears them in the fall and winter with socks
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Ansted

customer_reviews.title: Uneven Spacing
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from the photos the spacing on the right side of the right shoe is too large. This causes rubbing and discomfort. I sent the 1st pair back as defective and received another pair with the same issue. Amazon, as always, took care of me.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: My son loved them!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my son. He loves the shoes. Says they are comfortable on land or walking along the sandy beach. Was very happy to wear them in a 5 mile hike. Said they were comfortable. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: This is a comfortable shoe/sandal if you have wide feet, which I do 13E. The service is fantastic, the clips or ties if they wear out are replaced CHEERFULLY for free and YES, there is a Youtube video explaining how to do so. BRAVO!! Its about dam time a sandal is made for wide feet that has comnfort and durability built in. Its been a few years, shoe looks great. Thanks KEEEN!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Combs

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly comfortable sandal
customer_reviews.text: I have worn a pair of these sandals for over five years. I pretty much live in them in the summer. They are extremely comfortable and durable. I have high arches, so often have a problem finding sandals I can wear all day. The loops on the tongue and heel make it very easy to get them on and off, and the drawstring makes it easy to adjust to your feet.
customer_reviews.author: D. Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Klunky, too much neoprene.
customer_reviews.text: I got these locally without looking at the reviews. The 13Ds I got are probably 12Cs. The insoles are uncomfortable. The uppers are lined with neoprene, making the otherwise well-ventilated sandal quite warm. The toe box is not very roomy. Stay away. Jim Update September 28, 2016 Lowered rating from two stars to one star. Breaking them in offers little relief. Jim
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sandal
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a good sandal that would fit well and wear well in the real world. I think its a great deal for the fit and quality provided by Keen. I have always liked their products and this one so far is working well. Use caution sometimes the sizing is all over the place. I recommend that you order both your regular size and one half size bigger to try. I rather have a snug fit than a loose one.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod Paul Strickler

customer_reviews.title: Great Sandal, indeed!
customer_reviews.text: The Keen Men's Newport Sandal is, without a doubt, the best shoe I have ever owned. My pair is well over four years old and still going strong. My local outdoor store has discontinued the line, and you cannot blame them: you buy a pair and never need to purchase another. I'm an active walker and would give you an estimate of the mileage except you would not believe me. I'm unnecessarily ordering a backup pair, as I'm afraid Keen may someday discontinue the line.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Womelsdorf

customer_reviews.title: Great Sandals
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair and have not taken them off since. Easy to slip on and off these are the perfect pair for someone on the go. The unique toe guard protects your feet like no other sandal of this type. They also dry very quickly so if you spend a lot of time around water these could be the sandals for you. (Although the Newport H2's dry faster) To top it all off they feel great on my feet. Do yourself a favor and try these out you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Robb Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Best Sandals Available
customer_reviews.text: Bought these just before leaving on a 3 month trip to Sierra Leone with my university. The Newports never left my feet throughout the entire trip. I can not imagine how I would have tolerated 12+ hours on my feet everyday without these. They were comfortable, durable, and protective. These were my first Keens and never again will I own sandals from another company. Thank you Keen!
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars, no question...
customer_reviews.text: I can't add much more praise than the other reviewers. They are all spot on. I've owned a pair of Newport's for 3 years. They're still going strong & look almost new. Best sandals ever.
customer_reviews.author: Mtrcity

customer_reviews.title: Best sandals I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Toe cap protects your toes, comfortable and long lasting. I've had my pair of Keen Newports for 8 years and they have finally worn out after daily wearing year-round. Very comfortable, machine washable and easy to take off and put back on, even when wet.
customer_reviews.author: azasadny

customer_reviews.title: 100 Dollars well spent
customer_reviews.text: Even though these shoes are a bit expensive, I have never purchased a more comfortable or durable pair of shoes. Tough as nails. I have been using mine on a daily bassis for the past 18 months. I walk atleast 5 miles a day. Still holding up perfectly except for normal wear.
customer_reviews.author: R. Subramanian

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: 3 years and still amazing. My only shoe to go camping/canoeing. Then wear them every day..... even to church! I just ordered keen hiking shoes so I can wear something descent during the winter time! You can't go wrong with this sandal!
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Love. This
customer_reviews.text: I. Love. This. Sandal! Only thing I wear all summer long!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: expensive but nice sandal
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking pair of sandals. You need to wear them a bit before they conform to your foot, but overall I have been pleased. They look as though they will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Quincey Dog

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Mine is of very poor quality. Had the sandals for just over a year. Probably less than 5 months of use during Canadian summers. Now the stitches are coming off in two locations [...]). I expected the sandals to last longer than than.
customer_reviews.author: Arywon8765

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this shoe I ordered for him. It fits him really well and it is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jing Lin

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's Newport Sandal
product_meta.description:
Go back to the basics with the sandal that started it all, the Newport from KEEN. The secure fit strap design adjusts for a comfortable fit. The rubber outsole features a multi-directional lug pattern and razor siping for the right traction over wet.

Go back to the basics with the sandal that started it all, the Newport from KEEN. The secure fit strap design adjusts for a comfortable fit, and the washable nubuck leather looks good while remaining weather-resistant. The rubber outsole features a multi-directional lug pattern and razor siping for the right traction over wet and dry surfaces. The metatomical footbed conforms to your foot's shape for personalized comfort that's way beyond ordinary.

From beaches to mountains to city streets, Keen believes the outdoors is anyplace without a ceiling. Keen believes in living a HybridLife, which means being part of a greater community that is full of people who create possibilities, play in the outdoors and care for the world around them.

See more
feature_bullets: TRACTION & PROTECTION: Multi-directional lugs with razor siping help provide superior grip on slippery or wet terrain; Non-marking rubber outsoles leave no imprint when walking indoors; Iconic toe bumper offers additional safety to help prevent injury
SUPPORT & COMFORT: Lace-lock bungee capture system provides a secure fit while offering quick and easy on/off; Compression-molded EVA midsole for enhanced cushioning
FIT & INSOLE: This style is running a 1/2 size small, we suggest ordering a 1/2 size larger than your usual size; Non-removable EVA footbed with added arch support for all-day comfort

WATER-RESISTANT UPPER: Washable polyester webbing featuring quick-dry lining for active use in and out of the water; PFC-free, durable, water repellent helps shed water and prolong the quality and life of the material on these men’s sport sandals

CARE TIPS & ODOR PREVENTION: All KEEN water sandals are machine washable. Use a small amount of detergent, wash on gentle cycle and air dry; Includes Eco Anti-Odor, a natural, probiotic-based technology for breaking down the odor in sweat
